Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file.

plot_feature_importance.Rd

Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file.

Usage

plot_feature_importance(
  model,
  path_saved = NULL,
  fill_color = "steelblue",
  importance_type = 1,
  title = "Feature Importance",
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL
)

Arguments

model

Trained random forest model

path_saved

File path to save the plot. If NULL, plot is only returned but not saved.

fill_color

Color for the bars. Default: "steelblue"

importance_type

Type of importance to plot. Either "MeanDecreaseAccuracy" (1) or "MeanDecreaseGini" (2). Default: 1

title

Plot title. Default: "Feature Importance"

width

Plot width in inches when saving. Default: 10

height

Plot height in inches when saving. Default: 8

Value

Invisibly returns the ggplot object.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example random forest model for feature importance
library(randomForest)
df <- data.frame(
  adopted = factor(c("Yes", "No", "Yes", "Yes", "No")),
  feature1 = c(2.3, 1.1, 3.4, 2.1, 0.9),
  feature2 = c("A", "B", "A", "B", "A")
)
model <- randomForest(adopted ~ ., data = df)

# Plot feature importance
plot_feature_importance(model)
} # }
